content.title: Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana
content.details: The scheme 'Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana (BNTYY)' was launched by the Department of Tourism, Government of Odisha on 01st February 2016 in collaboration with IRCTC (Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation) wherein the pilgrims will be taken on a visit to different pilgrimage centers in the country from particular boarding points in the state as per the schedule approved for the journeys. The scheme is envisaged to help senior citizens over 60-75 years of age to undertake pilgrimage with Government assistance.
benefits: Opportunity for poor and deprived senior citizens (60-75 years) to fulfill their lifelong dream of Tirtha Darshan (Pilgrimage).
Open to people of all regions/faiths.
eligibility: Applicant must be over 60 years of age & within 75 years of age.
Applicant must be a domicile of Odisha.
Applicant should have the requisite fitness to undertake the journey and should not be suffering from any communicable disease.
An attendant can accompany applicants above 70 years of age.
The attendant must pay 50% of the travel cost.
A married couple can apply jointly.
The pilgrim can avail the benefit of a journey only once in a lifetime.
Applicant should possess any of the specified documents reflecting their weak economic status.
content.application_process: Applications can be submitted both online and offline. The application forms are available at various district offices and online. The application must be filled in the prescribed format and submitted before the deadline.
documents_required: Any of the specified economic status documents.

faqs.question: What is 'Baristha Nagarika Tirtha Yatra Yojana (BNTYY)'?
faqs.answer: BNTYY is a pilgrimage scheme launched by the Department of Tourism, Government of Odisha, in collaboration with IRCTC.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was officially launched on 01st February 2016.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to participate in the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is designed for senior citizens aged 60 to 75 years who belong to all regions and faiths within the state.

faqs.question: How does this scheme benefit senior citizens?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers government assistance to senior citizens, facilitating their pilgrimage journeys.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for the domicile of Odisha?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant has to be a domicile of Odisha.
